title: Gangplank does not look fat. He looks powerful.
body:
All the people saying the new Gangplank is fat have clearly never seen what exceptionally strong men look like. Large men with uber-well defined muscles are not actually stronger. Quite the contrary, the strongest men do not have a 6-pack of muscles, they have a keg. Take a look at Hafþór Júlíus Björnsson, arguably the strongest man alive. 
http://confitdent.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/tumblr_n5t1dcbxfg1r9h4heo2_1280-e1400485046865.jpg
He has broken several world records in weight lifting, weight throwing, and even the Strongest Viking competition. Now compare him to Gangplank:
http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-10c2PxNIXq0/Vb5UsgyBBeI/AAAAAAAAu0M/_cCl8l5Mk70/s1600/GP_Lineup.jpg
Gangplank does not look fat at all. He looks powerful. Indeed, he looks like he would be the strongest of all Non-Draven humans on the rift.
http://media.giphy.com/media/wiQ9N7iMkMH2o/giphy.gif

replies.body: The problem is that most people only know "Poweful" people by the standarized muscle-building look, and they aren't aware that the strongest people in the world are thick as fuck (no pun intended).

> [{quoted}](name=Postal Badger,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=nePrytBv,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-08-04T16:10:31.687+0000)
>
> The problem is that most people only know "Poweful" people by the standarized muscle-building look, and they aren't aware that the strongest people in the world are thick as fuck (no pun intended).

Could go into details and all, but this gets the point through to most people.

Exactly. Actors that play strong men have well defined muscles. This is because they purposely tear their muscles and let them heal, which increases bulk at the cost of efficiency. Actual strong men keep their muscles healthy and lean, which makes them look smoother. This confuses people into thinking it is fat, as fat is also smooth.

Not entirely.

The whole process of tearing and healing muscle is involved in *every* facet of strength training (whether for aesthetic bulk or actual power) because your muscles do not grow unless your body tells your brain "we aren't strong enough for the tasks you're making us do, divert more resources to making us bigger as we heal." Lack of definition doesn't come from not tearing down muscles, it comes from not going on a super fat burning diet right before a bodybuilder competition. In fact, most bodybuilders look an awful lot like that strongman in your OP when they are "bulking" (trying to add muscle mass to compensate for the mass lost when getting ready for a competition) and only look like the quintessential bodybuilder most people think of when they're "trimming" (basically dieting and doing super focused workouts that target very small independent muscles to improve definition).

The strongman that you shared a picture of does in fact have a lot of body fat which is why he does not have the same definition as a bodybuilder, but if he tried to diet away some of that body fat, he'd inherently atrophy away some of his muscle mass as well, for no gain outside visual appeal, which is why he and other strongmen don't try to look thin. They have healthy levels of body fat for adult men.

The difference between definition and lack of definition in these guys is also directly related to *how* they exercise. Strongmen exercise using general strength building workouts that focus on making them stronger as a whole, where bodybuilders use specialized workouts and machines that allow them to bulk up certain muscles that a normal human will hardly ever use on a day to day basis, which makes them and the muscles around them more defined.
This:

I know a family of strongmen personally.

The people are fucking terrifying yet surprisingly nice.
That's because they don't have any inadequacy issues LOL
Sweet Zombie Jesus!
This sort of picture only works if there's a common individual amongst all of them. Which there isn't.
There is. The guy on the right in the top picture is the guy in the middle on the bottom picture.

>Indeed, he looks like he would be the strongest of all Non-Draven humans on the rift.

Upvote for recognition of the strongest human on the rift.
{{champion:201}} i think you mean second strongest
Yea that's why he does zero damage.

first off, he actually does some pretty good damage.  maybe your problem is that you're playing with your eyes shut.

second, the guy punched through a mountain when the door wouldn't open.

I would waifu the mountain in a nanosecond. 

Oh man he is hot.

He would blow your mind. (I was going to include a gif of The Mountain crushing Prince Oberyn's head, but I think it is in violation of the rules. So instead I will post a gif depicting the scene with a watermelon.)
https://31.media.tumblr.com/25756ef547e48213889081f6a56c3031/tumblr_n6jdofcc2j1qfyveto1_500.gif
Always cringe when i see that guys head being blown apart by the eyes, 0/10 would not prefer that death.
And this is why I stop at {{item:3097}} and never get {{item:3401}}.  I can't even have that word or anything representing it anywhere near my inventory.
I mean, he's just so kawaii. Be my waifu, you sugoi mountain of moe material.

Permission to find and kill the downvoter?

http://i.imgur.com/VjgaKFG.png
http://i.imgur.com/eDUDBpr.gif

Remember a week ago when people were saying that the Fiora rework made her look like a 70-year-old Michael Jackson? They were right in that its certianly looked strange and not much like Fiora, but to say she looked elderly and hideous was a serious overstatement. Defined cheekbones and a thinner face hardly make for an unattractive person. 

And now they're calling the strongest dude on the rift "fat"

TLDR; people who use these forums have insane beauty standards.

> [{quoted}](name=AbrahamBaconham,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=nePrytBv,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-08-04T16:34:02.084+0000)
>
> Remember a week ago when people were saying that the Fiora rework made her look like a 70-year-old Michael Jackson? They were right in that its certianly looked strange and not much like Fiora, but to say she looked elderly and hideous was a serious overstatement. Defined cheekbones and a thinner face hardly make for an unattractive person. 
> 
> And now they're calling the strongest dude on the rift "fat"
> 
> TLDR; people who use these forums have insane beauty standards.

The problem with that Fiora look was that she was portrayed as a young woman and in her art and model she looked like she was in her late 50's. It just threw things off from the original idea of her being a young brash woman who thought she was the best.

The normal gangplank skin is kind of hammy.  I at i was with you guys but then i went on PBE to see the skin and his stomach is sticking really far out from the sides. He's no strong man he's a fatass. That again is hard to imagine since he was just blown up, nearly drowned and lost his arm. GP is a badass and you'd think he'd be able to work off those hams.

I'm sure he was sitting down for awhile but he's a pirate king. The last great pirate i knew  of wasn't thicker then he was smarter, then his opponents. 

No one minds fat {{champion:79}}  or old people {{champion:26}}  in this game they just don't like having unneeded and fairly easy to change shoved down their throats. 

Remember how people complained that new Zilean art didn't make him look old enough and that he looked like a badass mid 40's guy. People like their consistency.

> [{quoted}](name=Knalxz,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=nePrytBv,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-08-04T16:47:57.514+0000)

He's no strong man he's a fatass. That again is hard to imagine since he was just blown up, nearly drowned and lost his arm. GP is a badass and you'd think he'd be able to work off those hams.
> 
> I'm sure he was sitting down for awhile but he's a pirate king. The last great pirate i knew  of wasn't thicker then he was smarter, then his opponents. 
> 
> No one minds fat {{champion:79}}  or old people {{champion:26}}  in this game they just don't like having unneeded and fairly easy to change shoved down their throats. 
> 
> Remember how people complained that new Zilean art didn't make him look old enough and that he looked like a badass mid 40's guy. People like their consistency.

If you honestly think that THIS

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-n9WkmbxbHUM/VbLYt60NcII/AAAAAAAAuTo/P4C3ILt53V8/s640/Fiora_Splash_0.jpg

Is the face of a 50 year old woman, you need to take a step outside and take a good long look at some real humans.

Does she look different from Fiora's original artwork? Yes 
Is the change a bit shocking if you're used to original Fiora's round-faced look? Yes
Does she look a day over 25? Absolutely flipping not. Like I said earlier, her face is thinner and her cheekbones more defined, but those have never been traits exclusive to the elderly. In fact its a facial structure that is extremely prevalent, and quite often considered attractive, in many parts of Europe. 

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-wYvzhj-ym84/Vb7qvLlu3lI/AAAAAAAAu3A/HSNT0TLwZKs/s1600/gp.jpg

Repeating what OP stated, this is not the body of a "fatass," its the body of a powerfully built man. Strongmen and people of stocky build's aren't usually thin, they're beefy. They're thick.

About the Fiora image, you showed her fixed version, not the old version people were complaining about.

The cheekbones are a bit toned down in the new artwork, as well as her lack of bangs making her appear even older.
Even Gragas isn't really fat though, he's got a bit of a gut but if you look at the rest of his body, his arms and legs are also massive. Makes me want to see a pic of him and GP arm wrestling.

> [{quoted}](name=Knalxz,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=nePrytBv,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-08-04T16:47:57.514+0000)
>
> The problem with that Fiora look was that she was portrayed as a young woman and in her art and model she looked like she was in her late 50's.

...

The problem with Fiora is she looks pout-y as opposed to what she used to look like - a cocky and over-confident duelist.
Nah nah nah. This is different. Fiora DID look like michael jackson, that is not a good thing.

People get their ideas of muscle from body sculpting, which is an entirely different thing, and a relatively novel thing. I've even tried to explain to a friend of mine that without specialized training and equipment, it's pretty much impossible to get Bowflex abs.

I have a reference chart of various Olympic athletes from every sport from hammer toss to curling. For the strength-involved sports, the athletes are very bulky with little muscle definition. They have muscle; you just can't see most of it. Even in movies depicting hunky beefsteaks (Thor, Troy, 300, Wolverine) they don't have the kind of body tone you've come to expect based on Bowflex commercials. They have a LOT of muscle definition, but that's as much tone as you're going to get without outright specializing in it, and people building for strength are not going to focus on tone, and vice versa.

So yeah, Gangplank looks fat because people are stupid and don't know what REAL muscle and strength looks like. He's not fat; he's BARREL chested.
Well, also that plate looks heavy, you'll need a big body to carry it
Look at another example. He had the title of the strongest man in the world a long time.
*"mmmmmm. look at that camera guy. i bet he tastes like a cinnabon."*

I knew that.  However, his previous model (captain Gangplank) he looked comparatively fit instead of stocky.

He seems to have just gotten way more barrel chested in the few weeks he's been laying low, which is weird as hell.

In captain gangplank, he just look proportioned slightly cartoony, but average in terms of build, I would say.  In his new default skin, his belly sticks out noticeably more, whilst his upper body is just barely larger.

Also, look at his fuckin' man boobs in the new skin compared to his rippling pecs in the old one.  How the fuck do they split apart so much in a few weeks?

Taking a closer look, there actually isn't that much difference in his body, it only looks that way becasue of his clothes, The pads make his shoulders wider and his waist narrower by comparision. 

Also the coat on Captain Gangplank makes for several vertical lines which make him appear slimmer, while the new base has more horizontal lines which stretch sideways.

Good point. 
New gangplank is coming back soon. 
He wants to carry bitches and eat oranges.

Thing is, he wasn't really fat before, so the question that comes is...
Where did the fat come from?

It actually implies that now that he isn't captain of the biggest group of pirates in bilgewater (and bilgewater's effective "king") that now he has to do a lot more of his own grunt work, thus making him consequentially bulk up a bit from the extra labor.
You try recovering after surgery

The thing most people in this thread seemed to have missed is that a certain amount of fat in the body is good and helps the body function properly. So the op isn't entirely right because the person in his post is very very very strong but at the same time he has a healthy amount of fat which is quite a bit for a man of his size. The view of ripped abs isn't actually particularly healthy and as such limits the amount of muscle that can be built. So someone with defined muscle tone will definitely be strong they will not reach the level of someone who is just trying to get as strong as possible.

Is everyone forgetting {{champion:14}} Sion, specifically his Barbarian skin? This fucker is Tryndamere on steroids, and he's like 10 feet tall to boot. 

Or are we going to attribute his supposed strength to his re-animation? It's not like he was a scrawny nerd on the battlefield before he died.

Sion is still _very_ stout though. Like, the dude is basically egg-shaped if you look at his model directly from the front. Also, he was described as "a human battering ram" when he was alive. So he was likely very bulky... which he is.
Thats just peoples perception of things, they dont know jack

I'm fucking sick of people using "But they're supposed to be physically fit!" to justify hourglass figures and six packs on the Rift.
